thread.section_title: SEC.gov Updates: What's New in the Division of Corporation Finance
thread.title: No-Action Letter: Biomet, Inc.

title: No-Action Letter: Biomet, Inc.
text:
Securities Exchange Act of 1934 Rule 12h-3 Response of the Office of Chief Counsel Division   
Biomet, Inc. Incoming letter dated July 24, 2015 
Based on the facts presented, the Division will not object if the Registrants stop filing periodic and current reports   Exchange Act of 1934, including their annual reports on Form 10-K for the year ended May 31, 2015. We assume that, consistent with the representations made in your letter, the Registrants will file certifications on Form 15 making appropriate claims under Exchange Act Rule 12h-3 on or before the due date of their Forms 10-K for the year ended May 31, 2015. 
This position is based on the representations made to the Division in your letter. Any different facts or conditions might require the Division to reach a different conclusion. Further, this response expresses the Division's position on enforcement action only and does not express any legal conclusion on the question presented. 
Sincerely,
